Type.description: The type of trigger that this is.

StartOnCreation.description: Set to true to start SCHEDULED and CONDITIONAL triggers when created. True is not supported for ON_DEMAND triggers.

Actions.description: The actions initiated by this trigger.

EventBatchingCondition.description: Batch condition that must be met (specified number of events received or batch time window expired) before EventBridge event trigger fires.

WorkflowName.description: The name of the workflow associated with the trigger.

Schedule.description: A cron expression used to specify the schedule.

Tags.description: The tags to use with this trigger.

Predicate.description: The predicate of this trigger, which defines when it will fire.

Condition.description: Defines a condition under which a trigger fires.

JobName.description: The name of the job whose JobRuns this condition applies to, and on which this trigger waits.

CrawlerName.description: The name of the crawler to which this condition applies.

State.description: The condition state. Currently, the values supported are SUCCEEDED, STOPPED, TIMEOUT, and FAILED.

CrawlState.description: The state of the crawler to which this condition applies.

NotificationProperty.description: Specifies configuration properties of a job run notification.

NotifyDelayAfter.description: After a job run starts, the number of minutes to wait before sending a job run delay notification

Action.description: The actions initiated by this trigger.

NotificationProperty.description: Specifies configuration properties of a job run notification.

CrawlerName.description: The name of the crawler to be used with this action.

Timeout.description: The JobRun timeout in minutes. This is the maximum time that a job run can consume resources before it is terminated and enters TIMEOUT status. The default is 2,880 minutes (48 hours). This overrides the timeout value set in the parent job.

JobName.description: The name of a job to be executed.

Arguments.description: The job arguments used when this trigger fires. For this job run, they replace the default arguments set in the job definition itself.

SecurityConfiguration.description: The name of the SecurityConfiguration structure to be used with this action.

EventBatchingCondition.description: Batch condition that must be met (specified number of events received or batch time window expired) before EventBridge event trigger fires.

BatchSize.description: Number of events that must be received from Amazon EventBridge before EventBridge event trigger fires.

BatchWindow.description: Window of time in seconds after which EventBridge event trigger fires. Window starts when first event is received.

Predicate.description: The predicate of this trigger, which defines when it will fire.

Logical.description: An optional field if only one condition is listed. If multiple conditions are listed, then this field is required.

Conditions.description: A list of the conditions that determine when the trigger will fire.
